sentences.english: Gasoline for the pyre is getting to be a real problem.
sentences.chinese: 用於焚屍的汽油越來越成爲一個難以解決的問題。

sentences.english: Kratos speaks with the body burner one last time.
sentences.chinese: 克瑞託斯最後一次和焚屍人談話。

sentences.english: Better place for them is inside an incinerator to put things straight.
sentences.chinese: 他們更好的去處是在焚屍爐裏面，這樣才能整頓局面。

sentences.english: And you can also find the crematorium with running overloaded.
sentences.chinese: 此外，你還可以看到整日超負荷運轉的焚屍爐。

sentences.english: They look at the remains of prisoners lying on the ground and see crematorium ovens.
sentences.chinese: 他們望着地上以前戰俘遺留下的殘骸並參觀了焚屍爐。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to visit a prisoner (usu. a relative or friend)
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
Destroy the Four Olds (campaign of the Cultural Revolution)
